comments.body:
I want to add some suggestions:

  • A disadvantage of using binoculars could be that you have to equip in one of your hands (or use both) leaving to unable to use your sword/shield at the same time (or at all while you're looking). This, thinking about some PvP balance.
  • It could be enchanted to signal the presence of enemy (red), neutral (white) and friendly (green) mobs and other players (yellow). They would appear as a diffuse silhouette so you can't identify which mob is, but it will work even across solid blocks.
I have made this example!!
Just yes.
Binoculars are a bit too modern in my opinion. Maybe telescopes?
this would also be helpful if your computer can't handle maxing the render distance
I would just have binoculars that are basic and would just let you see far away. No need for anything fancy like marking mobs or creatures. Just simple optical zooming.
Just suggested that, except that it would zoom in like a spyglass, yet can zoom in further. You would be able to zoom in and out by scrolling the mouse wheel
I love this idea!
Great idea
yes pls.
This would be very funny.
You sold me! :)
Good enough for me!
Like like super zoom? Where you can zoom in a lot more? If so, that’s a great idea!
i would love a shiny spyglass
I recently saw someone sharing an idea (don't remember the source) of a "discover" enchantment revealing information about a mob like health and behavior

I wanted to post something following the same idea but then I saw yours so I'd like to help with the names,

Marksman - highlights any mob that is seen in the hit marker.

Luminescence -  when looking through the Spyglass it would be like having night vision.

Optics l, and ll - can see farther with spyglass

Scorching Lens - Sets fire to a mob at day if hit marker stays locked onto hitbox for 8 seconds (a loading bar to indicate how long)
I think you should also add where you can add it to a bow or cross bow as a kind of scope

The only one that will sold those enchantments will be the traveling merchant or in sunken ships. Other possibility is a new villager, the pirate. He will be found on beaches with a parrot on the shoulder or something like this.

I agree with the enchantments, specially the highlight for mobs could be really helpful for mob farms or looking for dungeons. I don't quite like the Snipers dream one, tho, I think it doesn't fit the aiming mechanic. But the other ones are really good ideas.
Love the fire lens it weaponized the spyglass so people will use it
Maybe expand upon what such a thing might look like...? (Maybe a carving of an Ender dragon head?)
Maybe the chiseled end stone could have the enderman's eyes carved on them

How would it be made?

 

I’m presuming the same way normal chiselled stone is

Honestly, end stone bricks should be given the same love as regular stone bricks, with the only exception being no mossy bricks due to no vines in the end. Cracked and chiseled end stone bricks should be added

I would love to see this along with Blue Nether Brick variants!

edit: better Prismarine Brick design as well as a chiseled variant would also be nice

designs could include:

-enderman head

-shulker(open shelled)

-ender dragon

-elytra

-ender pearl

-eye of ender

-end crystal

The 'rough' texture is a great complement to the light cobblestone color.

Cobblestone, as it appears, is too 'cartoony' to be used in my medieval build. I like the 'grittiness' of the texture and would like to use it as my city path-stone for high-traffic roads. Unfortunately I cant because of the lack of slabs & stairs.
IIt would be even better for pathways, rather than having a side texture when going up and down a hill. It would be a great finish
I love this idea! I’ve been hoping to get more basalt variants, and I think this would be a great addition.
maybe make it spawn naturally in the middles of the columns of basalt is the deltas?
Why not create it also in a stone cutter?

Well, adding one ore just to make another ore seems unnecessary. I think bronze would be more feasible, as copper could become a very useful metal that could be alloyed. Bronze would too be very useful. But adding alloys in Minecraft in general seems to create clutter. I do not oppose the addition of sliver itself as I was planning to make a post for it myself, but maybe you should include items that can be crafted with it with more direct uses.
@SomeAnimal, so you mean it would create to much hassle?
yes
yes , i think this is a good idea!
Perhaps make it a new use for the smithing table so u upgrade the golden tools with the silver to electrum

I agree, but maybe silver should be slow but very durable? This would kind of make it the opposite of gold like many people consider it irl, and will be useful if you just want a tool that lasts.

And electrum could be combined in a smithing table for a super fast (like gold) and super durable (like silver) material.

There’s just one problem here, that feather falling isn’t supposed to slow you down while falling, that is what the new potion of slow falling does. Feather falling only ‘reduces’ the damage that ‘you’ take from fall damage.

As much as your right E_deep 17, I would like to think that when you fall with Feather Falling on it not only reduces your fall damage but it would not disturb the blocks below either even when you take damage. Thank you for your feedback.
I could see this being added to the game!
What up MacchuPicchu! Sorry for getting of topic right now but it's good to see that you're still with us in the Feedback website.
Thanks for the kind words, Blast Burner :D tbh I'm mostly back to see if Mojang says anything about my trading reforms idea. My expectations are low, but I can dream, right?
This is definitely needed as a feature especially for people like me who make megafarms. A patch like this would just be a quality of life change, but one we desperately need!

Definitely bro! It's so annoying having to make a hoe just to fertilize one patch of dirt. Adding this to the game would make the enchantment more appealing.

Also, feather falling shouldn't break turtle eggs, just a minor idea :D

Ooooo. That idea makes me smile.

You could also make it so that the base wool color could deterimine the stating color, that way you could have them in different syncs. You could use that to make it a wall with moving rainbow patterns.
Also... Drumroll please... Badadadadadadada... JEB BEDS!
Or the wool could change color based on the strength of a redstone signal, so you can select specific colors.
That would be great Galiantus  but seeing that it has no relationship with redstone I don't see that happening. Or maybe it will. It's up to Mojang.

@Blast Burner

You're likely correct. Whatever the case this would be a fun addition. : )
Ah i see you are a man of culture too
So it changes color every time you place  and break it? Sounds cool
I mean, black sheep give you black wool. red sheep give you red wool. the pink sheep in the cage name tagged gives you pink wool. but jeb_ sheep give you regular wool.
While I feel that a nautilus mob of some sort would be more aesthetically pleasing, I love the attempt to turn underwater ravines and caves into a worthwhile destination. You have my vote.
this would definitely make me want to bother to visit an underwater ravine ^^
Love the idea!
Amazing idea. I hope the Mojang crew sees this right away.
I think that the nautilus shell would require more uses first.
Excellent idea! It would make underwater mining interesting, because actually it's useless
hey as an aspiring paleontologist finding a fossil like this would be awesome. i would love to be in a cave and all the sudden i see a fossil nautiloid!
sounds cool but I want a nautilus mob like for real how do you have the shell if the mob doesn't exist
This would be a great addition to Caves & Cliffs (or a future ocean trench update for it), fitting with how fossils can be found in the Deep Dark.
weird....
I love this! You have amazing ideas, WhoseverRex1013!!! :D :D
Thank you

No support. We already cheat enough with nether portal fast transport. Also, the creators are putting too much time into making the overworld look nice just to skip thru it. If we had a fast locomotive first then maybe. But for now no support here. 

Have a nice day.

This also sounds complicated to implement. If you have three of these in your world, how would you decide which of the other two you land on? Would you get to pick using a GUI? If so you're basically proposing we have the ability to insta-teleport to anywhere in our worlds after getting a small supply of ender pearls. That is ridiculously overpowered.

Also: yeah, enjoy the scenery, and if you want to get somewhere fast, make a network of portals in the nether instead of asking for cheap shortcuts like this one. Sorry, but I also do not support this idea.

If it could teleport you any where it be way to op, but if it had a range of like 16 blocks it would be fine. I think if you sneak on it it would teleport you to the closest ender pearl block i n the direction your facing.

I agree with this idea but I think it should be more expensive to make so players can't easily craft these just to get around. Maybe the crafting recipe should have a netherite, or even a block of netherite surrounded by ender pearls to get 2 because they could even be placed thousands of blocks away from each other and be used in other dimensions.
I support a decorative ender block! A block that looks like redstone block, but in the deep bluish teal of the end pearl. "Ender Pearl Block", would consist of 4 enderpearls each.
I would also like to have ender pearl block
They should also add when you name a pig Techno the have a crown just add something to commemorate him
Yes do this :*(
This would be awesome maybe they can add a crown to the pig painting as well
They've added "Technoblade never dies!" splash text

absolutely. it's obscenely expensive. 

i for one propose that chains be made out of iron nuggets. 3 nuggets in a line to one chain. 6 ingots for 18 chains is quite reasonable.

--Cyrus Draegur
This is a shockingly great idea

I had an idea to separate the offhand with it’s own action from sneak; to allow the lowering and raising of the shield with a wider, shorter shield. In this situation you’re doing so while not crouching, so you’re moving at regular speed. Crouching would lower you behind the shield.
Reason for this is to not only open up the offhand for blocking, but offense, utility to work in unison of the mainhand, but also open up and reserve (an action button & category) for simple defensive maneuvers later on over time; rush, dodge, parry, etc.
But I’m not against the enchant at all, very practical purpose!

This is a dope idea! It would help with crowd control, while remaining balanced. Plus, the shield would have to occupy your main or off-hand anyways. I don't think that ramming mobs should do damage, or if it does, at least not a lot of damage. But I definitely like this idea! Mojang! <---LOOK
And doors
Just considering, wouldn't be cool if you could put blocks that are just able to be broken by the player who placed it?? For vanilla servers would be good...

So I was having a similar idea. 
We should have a padlock that can be placed on doors and chests to make them unusable without a key. 
A player COULD theoretically just mine the door or chest anyway though... 

I don't think they should be craft-able though. Just have locked doors and chests generate in Nether Fortresses, Mansions, and mob spawner rooms. That way, there's only one key for each lock. 

Though I would like to see another type of lock spawn in the Nether as well. 
Instead of a key, this one would spawn in Piglin Bastions and take a gold coin. It would then re-lock itself when the door or chest closes, kinda like a vending machine.
Stone is not an ore.
The cobblestone is stone in pieces
Under the earth, there is stone, if you break the stone with a pickaxe, the stone is destroyed and the result are some rocks, and a group of those rocks is called cobblestone, so plz don't change it
Let Craft items with endstone what ideas could there be?
Remember that someone actually had this thought and decided that it was a good idea to post it

Is today April 1st?

This will cause cobblestone smelting to become cobblestone ore !!

Grass = Dirt Ore
Ice = Water Ore
Pigs = Bacon Ore
Skeletons = Bone Ore (haha get it)
I’m sorry, but I don’t want to rename stone to cobble stone ore. It been around for a long time, so why change it now? Anyone agree?
I don't like how it sounds, and everyone is used to just cobblestone

First off I don’t think there are any stupid ideas. This probably seemed like a good plan however stone is a raw and smooth material that when broken up becomes cobble. This is not the same with dirt because dirt mixed up is still dirt. Ore is usually stone mixed with an element. The stone is impure, not all the same thing. That’s why when smelted, it is the refined element without the slag from stone (maybe slag should be added to furnaces)
No, stone is stone, not an ore
Stone is not an ore! Deal with it!
Absolutely pointless. Why? J-just why?
Also fortune should drop more cobblestone.

No thats not a good idea because you can burn cobblestone back to normal stone... Is there another ore which can do this? And its just getting cobblestone because the stone breaks when you hit it with your pickaxe...

No, stone is not an ore. The the reason why other blocks have been called an ore is because, as they exist in the real world, they are ores.

If you were to say that anything that drops another item is an ore then you could say that grass blocks are just dirt ore
Can you smelt diamonds into diamond ore in a furnace? I don't think so
Stone is NICE name

Warum sollte man das umbenennen?
Ich meine 1. warum sollte das ein Erz sein. 2. Ist der Name so gut wie er ist und hat sich bei jedem so eingebrannt.
Komplett dämliche Idee könnt ihr gleich streichen.
Just call it contact cobble😁
Guys come on it's just a joke seriously have you never heard a joke before?
You know... He's actually right!
Hi folks, your friendly admin here, reminding you we need to keep it civil and constructive when we're making positive and negative comments.
Y'all ever heard of a joke? Anyway, 10/10, this better be added.
Are you people really taking this seriously? It was obviously a joke.

Well, smelting the ore gives the material, so it would make more sense if cobblestone is renamed to stone ore.

Better yet, stone gets renamed to smooth stone ore, and cobblestone is now smooth stone ore ore.
you cant smelt it into cobblestone, so good meme, not a good sugestion.
Stone is not an ore, its stone. It drops cobblestone because the stone gets spit into cobblestone when mining.
Maybe implement this as one of the april fools day snapshots?
This is great for puzzle maps!
I'd rather call this spectral blocks and a potion effect called spectral phase. But maybe you could normally see these blocks but only as a barely viable glow.

You could make the item to make the potion be an item with a low drop rate from nightmares because they don't appear always. I'm actually all for this idea. Could be a special Castle that spawns only at night too. Then it disappears at dawn and the potion only works at night and ends at daytime. Also being able to see a faint outline or light or something during the day to see it would make it able to be found.
Yeah! This potion should be brewed from warped berries found in the warped biome
I love it! It would be cool for parkour too

I think this will really mess around with just the block system in general. What happens when you place a block on an imaginary block or drink the potion while inside it? This really is a new plane of existence
I was thinking something more like invisible liquid... you can only see it when you are in touch with it. What do you say??😏
Can it collect air too

Yes! I can’t believe this doesn’t have more votes! I agree! We need Oranges! For someone who loves all citrus fruits, I would LOVE to see this added! Maybe they could also add a juicer block that you’d use to put the oranges into bottles and then you could drink it as orange juice! I KNOW I would have an orange tree field! MOJANG, YOU GOTTA DO THIS!
I like this idea. maybe the fruit will drop automatically(like the apple from oak trees), or you can broke the leaves to get more.

Perhaps combining oranges with water bottles and sugar in crafting would give orange juice, and the citrus tree would drop it's respective logs, which would look slightly like jungle trees, but the bark is more like acacia and the orange shade is deeper. They can be crafted into sticks, and their respective signs, pressure plates, buttons, planks, etc. They will be very rare as to be only found occasionally in a jungle biome, or more commonly when a taiga and jungle biome meet.
I like this idea! You can also make a golden version of it! Like apples!

Leather armor loot. 

This suggestion was hard to find buried in everything else!  I hope this gets seen more.  It's a needed change!!
It would be great to have other uses for leather armor such as converting into picture frames.

I've wanted to be ale to scrap leather armour and saddles from fishing for forever

Even if we could break it down into "patches" of leather, then 9 patches make 1 leather piece similar to nuggets making ingots

I am not a hoarder. I'm practical. =)

I hold onto older/damaged iron/gold goods. Once I have a tall stack of each, I'll smelt to recover nuggets. As neither material is affected by the Fortune enchant, every little bit helps. Though with that said keep in mind when farming cows for leather, the Looting enchant makes it easier to farm & the scrap process would only serve as a means of something to do with spare leather good

 

For me there is no purpose for ever keeping a saddle or leather armor (aside aesthetics.) Now if I could convert that leather into some books, then that's an incentive to cache leather goods.

 

I would keep small hides as is, but add leather scraps with 9 creating 1 leather. These scraps are harvested & combined at a one site. The caldron does not really make sense, the loom kind of fits, but there is always the option of a secondary supplementary profession item; a hide rack. The rack requires more work, but the loom would only need a UI adjustment. Potion making may utilize the cauldron even though it's profession is based off the brewing stand, so it's not far off to believe the loom could be used to combine leather scraps.
Literally modding in "smelt leather armor -> yield 1 rabbit hide" would provide the same functionality as all the armor types sans diamond. (Idk how I'd feel about diamond "nuggets" though.)
This would also make it easier to craft bundles -- chasing down rabbits is fun for the first couple minutes, but kind of tedious after that!

There definitely needs to be an easier way to deal with this mob drop, if it was as simple as if the item can't be smelted it doesn't fall into the top furnace slot, this would solve pretty much all the problems with leather and other sorts.

Scrap leather or event "Small Leather" would be epic for decraft broken leather gear or cut leather down for bundle recipes officially instead of datapack repicpe work around. 

I even datapack to smelt the leather to charcoal just to clear inventory, which feels a bit of waste given leather is useful in Minecraft just not after its crafted.
maybe we can scrap into rabbit hide
We should be able to scrap beef leather armor or regular armor so leather can be used more instead of disposed of.
I have loads of leather that doesn't have purpose.  At least make this into something like cutting it into leather strips for brading into a rope for clinbing.

My post was about "Disassembling Leather Items" which got removed, so I'm assuming this post was why, as It is similar.  

User Story:
As a Minecraft Player,
I want to be able to disassemble/take apart leather items,
so that I can re-use the leather scraps on something else.

Detail:

  • Currently we can 'repair' leather and other armor, but putting 2 pieces of leather armor together.  The resultant strength/durability is a sum of the 2 pieces.
  • Currently we can smelt Gold, Iron, and Chainmail armor down into nuggets (regardless of the durability left on the item)
  • Currently we can NOT take leather armor/items apart.

This capability could be added in such a way that the player could either disassemble Leather armor/items in either a

  • crafting table, or
  • grindstone (currently used for removing enchantments)

A player disassembling a leather item (regardless of size (pants/chestplate/helmet/boots) or durability) would recieve a (1) 'leather scrap', which would roughly be equivalent to 1 rabbit hyde.

  This provides some parity to the ability to reclaim resources from Gold, Iron, and Chainmail armor, in the Leather department.
I do want this! It would be nice if you're doing an island playthrough, or a challange, you could get leather from scrapping leather boots from fishing!
This is already a suggestion.
YES this should be a thing!
i woud like it to smelt and stone into smooth stone to
It make more sense to have a glass bottle of milk then to have a bucket of milk.
You know that in real life farmers use buckets to get milk, and not straight from the bottle right?
385941259632 You know that in real life people drink milk from bottles, and not straight from the bucket right?

I agree with having milk bottles, but maybe going about it in a different way. I would suggest getting the milk from a cow with a bucket, as you normally would, but then to be able to transfer the milk to a cauldron. You would then use a glass bottle to retrieve the milk from the cauldron. This would follow the same mechanic as filling bottles of water (and also potions in Bedrock Edition).

As for a reason why having milk bottles would be a good idea, I believe that milk should be treated the same as potions, seeing as it can be used in combat. Whereas potions can be used to add effects such as fire resistance and healing, milk can be used to negate effects such as poison and bad omen. In addition, it also just makes more sense to drink milk from a bottle, instead of a bucket. It just feels silly to gently sip a delicately concocted potion from a hand crafted glass bottle right after chugging milk from a bucket, all during combat.

I agree with your opinion. In real life Most people drink milk using a bottle instead of a bucket. Bottles of milk should be obtained through the milk buckets on the crafting table or in the cauldron. Bottles of milk should also be different milk bucket, where the milk bucket is able to clean all the effects, while the milk bottle only cleans one effect, mainly negative effects
Good idea

While milking a cow with a bottle seems more unrealistic than the bucket, I think this idea is better overall. Not only could you drink it to recover status conditions, but if you could brew it into a splash milk bottle, that would be even better, especially in PvP (both for removing positive effects from your opponents and negative ones from teammates).
Yeah. Overall, Carpets should not prevent the glyphs from reaching the enchanting table, I think.
You can feed it to fish, turtles and possibly other swamp mobs. All animals of the swamp should enjoy it and enter love mode.

I do not think it should be 3 hunger bars. Algae seems too simplistic to give you a whole 3 hunger bars.  One, perhaps, but not 3.

Also, there should be two types of "Algae": "Underwater Algae" & "Surface Algae".
Both, like grass, can spread., but over different block types.

  • Underwater Alage - Can cover gravel, stone, sand, dirt, & bone. It works like grass does, and covers the block as an "overlay", and is broken by right-clicking with a shovel.
  • Surface Algae - Can only cover water source blocks. It works like carpet, and is broken by contact.

Both have a chance to drop an "Algae Clump", which can be used to make an "Algae Block", which is very slippery.
No food points.  Algae should be slippery only when on a block that isn't water.  And, make it able to scoop up in a bucket.
I think this would be a welcome addition to swamps in 1.19. However, if algae is common in swamps, it shouldn't fill hunger. Maybe you could make some sort of thatch from it instead?

you should be able to make biofuel using algae and kelp and if you cook it you should be able to make green dye
also, algae would be used in the composter and it would create more levels in the composter than other easy to farm plants (grass, kelp, etc)

algae should not be edible because a lot of species of algae are poisonous
if you slip on it swamps would be even more annoying

The first idea sounds tremendously overpowered. You could add mending to a poison sword and essentially have infinite poison capabilities.... I don't approve. And adding banner customization to armor probably would not look good.

Edit: still not a huge fan of the idea because I feel it would just make things complicated. But the change to make it not work with Mending helps balance your idea a lot!
That's true, but they made Infinity not work with tipped arrows so you would expect some sort of debuff from the laced weapon and I'm not sure about the armor, but it's just an idea
Yes like emreld stuff too make it powerful
Not liking the idea about laced weapons, but love the idea on custom armor. Should have custom weapons instead of laced.
thats a great idea!
We definitely need to get some useful stuff for the glowsquid now that the choice has already been made. It is a cool idea.
Imagine how this will looks like with shader. Great Idea! This also will add more uses for glowsquid
There's already glowsticks in Education Edition. Doubt they'll add them since it's supposed to be an exclusive item that needs all of the elements in Education Edition.
407653164872 But then again, they can just change the look and the name like for example, Glow Rod. I hope that they really add this to the original game
I always wanted a colored Endrod. This can be a good alternative and also will give Glow Squid more uses
This idea is great, I suggest that this thing should be named "Glow Rod" to avoid confusion between the Glowstick in Education edition and this
Great idea, but since Glowstick in real life doesn't shine that much, I think the light level should be just around 5-7 like Glow Lichen
Yeah this is an amazing idea and that could make the Glow Squid even more useful.
I’d love this! Glow sticks are already a thing in Education Edition, and it’d be great to see in the official game!
This should be a thing! They should be throwable if you can't place them within range, that way you can light up far away areas! I made a mockup, if you want to add it to the post!
Also, the crafting recipe might be a bit expensive, perhaps it should just be 1 glow ink sac and 1 stick to make 4 or 8 glowsticks?

388047102232 I can't add more stuff to the post cuz it will be counted as violating the rules in the feedback site, but thanks for the suggestions and the comments. I like your version of the recipe, maybe 4 are enough.
It would be awesome if we had a throwable light source
It did not work for me.
But fr finally glow squids have a point in life
Btw I play on bedrock if that changes anything
Completely agree especially if your using a controller and have to rewrite a full sign just because a spelling mistake or something else.
I need this
When the sign/book editing interface was reworked, I was hoping this would be added as well. The ability to open the editing interface of a sign after already having saved it.

What could be a useful way to make this happen, is by right-clicking the existing sign with another sign.
Because when placing signs, you usually have more than one on you anyway, and this way you don't need a new/unrelated item to be able to edit the sign. And this way you also can't accidentally edit the sign if you right-click it unintentionally while just passing by (in case the edit function were on an empty hand).
A really annoying feature. You just have to missclick on the sign instead of a chest, and you already edit this sign. There should be a gamerule to disable this.
